DataElement.preferredName: Unilateral Nodal Disease Contralateral Palantine Tonsil Three Biopsies Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not three biopsies of the contralateral palantine tonsil were performed if the patient had unilateral nodal disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Unilateral Lymph Node Disease or Disorder Contralateral Palatine Tonsil Three Biopsy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side._A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._On or relating to the opposite side of the body._Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Unilateral Lymph Node Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Involving only one part or side.:A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Involving only one part or side.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Contralateral Palatine Tonsil Three Biopsy Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.:Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.:A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.
Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Executed and carried through to completion.
